item.title: Captivate upgrades to 2.0
item.description:
In Podnews today: Podcast trends, ad impressions vs downloads, and some research
Visit https://podnews.net/update/captivate-2 for all the podcasting news, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/captivate-2 for all the links, and to get our newsletter.

  • Podcast host Captivate has unveiled what it calls Captivate 2.0: a refresh of the user interface, a new trackable short-links tool, an "omni-search" service for quick navigation, and a simpler global one-click distribution service for podcast directories. Mark Asquith, pictured above, told Podnews: "We always wanted to make the real potential of podcasting more accessible to everyday podcasters, and we think the new features and the flexibility that these upgrades offer for the future are a game-changer." Podnews's Editor is an advisor to the company.
  • Do you use your podcast download figures to report ad impressions to your advertisers? If you're using DAI, those numbers aren't going to be the same, Bryan Barletta says in this week's Sounds Profitable with Claritas.
  • Adam Bowie, Business Development Manager at the BBC World Service, has published a transcript of his talk made at Podcast Day 24 - the top 10 podcast trends in 10 minutes. It's excellent. Also, read a writeup of the full 24 hours at RedTech, which includes a picture of Podnews's Editor in a suit.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Let Us Help You Take the Hassle Out of Podcasting! — Pod House Media is a full-service podcast production house focused on helping entrepreneurs, brands, and organizations start, grow, and manage their podcast.

Prices increase TODAY for Podcast Movement 2021! — Join thousands of podcasters (safely) for the return of the largest and longest running conference and expo for podcasters and the podcast industry. REGISTER BY MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO SAVE BIG!

Podcast Subscriptions Without Giving Away 30% — With Supercast, you own your customer relationships, you keep more of your paid subscription dollars, and Supercast works on both iOS & Android. Create your premium subscription today.

Boost your audience with Podcast SEO — Do you know for which search queries your podcast surfaces on Apple Podcasts or Spotify? At which position? And how to improve those positions to gain more visibility. Find out with Voxalyze.

Engage your audience with Interactive Audio — Are you looking for new ways to engage your listeners? Don’t miss this opportunity to join Giide’s free beta program to experience the power of interactive audio. Add your name to the waitlist today.

  • What does next generation podcasting look like? Jemily Rime, a PhD Student in the Department of Music at the University of York, is doing some research with XR Stories and BBC R&D: if you're a podcast creator interested in new technologies, she would like to hear from you.
  • Listen, a UK audio producer, has announced a strategic partnership with Platform, a creative content group. Platform works with high-profile talent; Listen produces radio and audio shows across UK media.
  • While we don't get it for podcasts, you might be interested in this explainer about Spatial Audio for music by Apple Music's Zane Lowe.
  • A female carpenter in Canada, who called out sexist language in the The Construction Life podcast, was threatened with a $15m defamation lawsuit by the male hosts for doing so. After publicity, they quickly changed their mind.
  • Edison Research has announced the Smart Audio Report Australia 2021 will be webcast on June 23 at 11am AEST (see pod․events for your time), to look at where and how Australians are currently using smart speakers and voice assistants.
  • Entale's Wil Harris has stepped down as CEO: co-founder Hannah Blake is now CEO, and Claire Roberts is to become Chief Product Officer. Harris will continue to be on the Board. The company has also announced a beta version of a new podcast discovery tool, and was shortlisted in the CogX Awards.
  • We covered Libsyn's additional equity financing yesterday; it looks like Hudson Executive Capital invested $9m.
  • Ben Thompson from Stratechery has released Passport, a suite of tools to allow creators to produce a podcast, newsletter, website (and SMS messages), as a paid or free service. It also integrates directly with Spotify.
  • LiSTNR, from Australian broadcaster SCA, claims 2.7 million listeners to its premium original podcasts, and an 18% increase year-on-year. The LiSTNR brand was launched in February, combining their radio apps with the former PodcastOne podcast platform.
  • In Singapore, Apple Media Product's production support team is looking for an Escalation Engineer for troubleshooting, tracking and resolving issues. This Engineer will play a technical troubleshooting role for customer and partner issues in products including Apple Podcasts.
  • The Apple Podcasts charts appeared to have frozen for a few days earlier this week. It's working as normal now. See above.
  • The Podnews RSS feed now supports the podcast:alternateEnclosure: we offer an AAC, MP3 and low-bitrate Opus variant for you. (The AAC is marked as default; the normal enclosure for most audiences is mp3).

Hints and tips

  • The pandemic gave us an amazing thing to promote our podcast - the QR code.

Podcast News

  • From the HubSpot Podcast Network: Growth isn't a bad thing, but too much growth means challenges for your operations and your Business Infrastructure. You'll hear solutions and real life stories to help.
  • The Frenemies podcast, part of The H3 Podcast, has ended after a big argument on their show (although it's done similar before).
  • Bose and Spotify have launched a Music + Talk show called A life in tracks, featuring interviews with notable Black stars including Russell Wilson, Allyson Felix, Rotimi and more to learn about the music that shapes their lives in celebration of Black Music Month in June.

item.title: Apple to reveal where your podcast data goes
item.description:
In Podnews today: Facetime is coming to Android too. Apple Podcasts isn't.
Visit https://podnews.net/update/apple-privacy-podcasts for all the podcasting news, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/apple-privacy-podcasts for all the links, and to get our newsletter.

  • Apple's WWDC event announced new privacy features, which could impact podcast publishers in future. The App Privacy Report will allow users to see what domains have been requested by apps, which may be useful for seeing if data from your podcast app is shared with others. A "Private Relay" will be available for all iCloud+ paid customers. It appears to be a combination of a secure DNS service and a VPN. It's only available when browsing with Safari at present; if extended out to the rest of the OS, it could give some challenges to podcast measurement and dynamic audio insertion. Apple has a video podcast of the full event.
  • Apple's Facetime is coming to the web, including Android phones, in September. We were expecting an announcement about Apple Podcasts coming to Android, but that hasn't happened: they've got things to fix first, we guess.
  • Triton Digital's programmatic audio marketplace has integrated with PayTunes, an Indian audio ad platform.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

This is Today Podcast - the unique story of today — Every weekday, listen to learn about the national celebrations and historical and pop-culture events that make each day unique. At just ten minutes a day, it's a great addition to your daily routine.

Want More Dimension In Your Podcast? — Learn about sound design, music and more in the mini-course Sound Design For Podcasters from Berkeley Advanced Media Institute.

Is your podcast ready for sponsors? Take the quiz! — I've been turning a profit from my podcast for 5 years. Ready to learn how it's done? Take the quiz and find out!

Subscribe to Version One — Hear from the creators of Abstract, Webflow, and other top tech companies about the journey to creating that all-important first version of their product!

  • Linktree, a service many podcasters use for links to their show, has added Commerce Links to help collect payments using Square.
  • Libsyn completed its acquisition of AdvertiseCast for $30m. It also completed $25m of equity financing, including $8m from Libsyn Director Eric Shahinian's Camac Partners - Camac now owns 12.2% - and $1m from Chairman Bradley Tirpak. They've also agreed a new bank loan agreement. The company is currently without a CFO, after it was found to have underpaid $3.2 million in taxes over the past five years.
  • Clubhouse "is dying", says a Forbes contributor. The writer suggests it's been replaced by meeting with real people.
  • A podcast about the murder of Vincent Chin in 1982, Hold Still Vincent, has been taken offline after it emerged that his family had not been contacted during the making of the part-fictionalised podcast.
  • Les Hollander has been promoted to CEO at DAX in North America.
  • Erik Diehn has left Stitcher. "Now it’s time for me to take a break, work on some fun projects and figure out what's next."
  • SiriusXM is to distribute and represent five Sawdust Podcast Network shows.
  • The Guardian claim that "podcasters have replaced our real friends".
  • UK radio station Absolute Radio is to launch a new "digital-first documentary series", called Tales from the Cloakroom. It is an exclusive show in the station's app.

The Tech Stuff

  • PodLP, a KaiOS app used in many developing countries, now supports the Person, Location and Funding tags.
  • Adam Curry is on the front cover of radio industry trade RadioINK this month, focusing on Podcasting 2.0.
  • The alternateEnclosure tag is being formalised today. The tag offers a variety of opportunities for podcasters: low-bitrate or video versions of shows in the same feed, alternate mixes, or longer versions of interviews. Podnews intends to offer a low-bitrate version of our show.
  • The licence tag is now formalised, allowing podcasters to mark shows or episodes with a specific licence, like creative commons or similar.
  • There's a proposal to indicate that a podcast is using podping: to allow a podcast directory to know when they can stop polling an RSS feed for new episodes.

Hints and tips

  • Steve Goldstein notes that Wheel of Fortune, a US TV game show, starts playing the game in just 45 seconds from the start of the show: and that podcast intros are way too long.
  • Spotify has published a set of data from its music service - though there's plenty of ideas for podcasters, too.

Podcast News

  • From the HubSpot Podcast Network: My First Million brainstorms ideas for new businesses. Recently, Shaan and Sam have covered a horse racing company with a difference: there are no horses.
  • Britstralian is a podcast about Brits down under in Australia: it's from Anna Moran, a former UK radio newsreader.
  • In School of Podcasting, Dave Jackson talks to Dan Franks to find out how the preparation for Podcast Movement in Nashville is going.
  • Death In Ice Valley has its first episode in more than two years, with listener-generated leads about the search for the Isdal Woman.

item.title: Consumers prefer podcast ads to TV ads
item.description:
In Podnews today: Facebook turns on some podcast support; Overcast author accuses Apple of dishonesty and insult; Deezer shares podcast stats
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podcast-ads-vs-tv-ads for all the podcasting news, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podcast-ads-vs-tv-ads for all the links, and to get our newsletter.

  • Consumers are more receptive to podcast advertising than TV advertisements, says a new study from media intelligence company MAGNA and Spotify. Of interest, "75% of respondents said they frequently relisten to podcast episodes".
  • Facebook appears to be turning on podcast support for some pages, in preparation for a June 22 launch. The email sent to some podcast owners links through to a page like facebook.com/(yourpage)/settings/podcasts/ to opt in and supply your RSS feed; our page is not yet enabled.
  • Marco Arment, the developer of podcast app Overcast, writes a blog post accusing Apple of being dishonest, factually wrong and extremely insulting. As its relationship with developers gets worse, Apple's relationship with podcasters isn't much better.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

PRICES INCREASE WEDNESDAY to Podcast Movement 2021 — The world's largest conference and trade show for podcasters and industry pros returns this August in Nashville. Register by midnight Wednesday before prices increase!

SELL ADS ON YOUR PODCAST WITHOUT ALL OF THE WORK. — Rockable handles your ad bookings so you can stay focused on creating an amazing show. Tap into a marketplace of advertisers on the hunt for high quality host-read podcast ads.

  • The Washington Post has launched a new podcast, Please, Go On, a weekly podcast from opinion columnist James Hohmann. It's another that hasn't been able to launch on the Apple Podcasts platform on time, by the looks of things.
  • Deezer has released some statistics about podcast consumption on the platform. "Society & Culture" was May's top genre worldwide; May 2020's was Comedy. Deezer users in Germany and France consumed most podcasts; US listeners consumed least. [Here's where to add yourself to Deezer and other podcast directories] (https://podnews.net/article/our-podcast)
  • Yes, podcasting is popular in Hong Kong, too. #impact podcast has published over 150 episodes and mentored other new podcasters who have entered the Hong Kong market recently.
  • Blue Wire now has more than 160 podcasts, and the founders talk to a sports website about the upcoming Blue Wire slate.
  • Starburns Audio has announced a new slate of audio projects, following the sudden death of CEO Jason Smith in March.
  • A tool to help marketers get the most out of their podcast content, Casted has added a number of new product features: audio search, videograms and audience insight. The CEO, Lindsay Tjepkema, was guest on the Podland podcast a few weeks ago.
  • Podtrac's US top 20 podcasts for May 2021 has an unchanged top ten, excepting Dan Bongino rising one place to 10. Bongino has taken the place of the late Rush Limbaugh on a number of stations. Of the US publisher list, iHeart remains #1, with almost a third more audience than NPR. It measures participating publishers only.
  • Podcast host Captivate showed off a preview of Captivate 2.0, which offers a number of additional features for the growth-oriented podcast host. Podnews's Editor, James Cridland, is an advisor.
  • Today is Alex Birch's last day at PRX, the company has announced. She'd managed the company's Podcast Garages in Boston and Washington DC; the company closed the Washington DC space permanently a few weeks ago.
  • It's currently Radiotopia's annual fundraiser. They're looking for 2,000 new donors to donate $13 a month.

Thank you to Podcast Network Solutions for recently becoming a new Gold supporter. A service to help you launch, produce and professionalize your podcast, or even to create your own podcast network, the company is based in the US and UK. Their support, like yours, helps us focus on our independent journalism.

Tips and tricks

  • Castos examine how to 'eliminate' background noise when recording. Blankets, keeping a microphone away from your computer, or even usng background music all help.
  • We Edit Podcasts look at monetising your podcast through donations. The article recommends incentive options for people who want to donate.
  • Arielle Nissenblatt shared how she almost reached 100,000 downloads for a show of hers without spending money on ads or being part of a network.

  • From the HubSpot Podcast Network: The Salesman Podcast is the world's most downloaded B2B sales podcast - helping sales professionals learn how to find buyers and win business from them in a modern, effective, and ethical way.
  • Kathy Doyle, the Vice President of Podcasting at Macmillan, is the latest guest on Insider Interviews with EB Moss. Macmillan is the only big-five book publisher with its own podcast network.
  • It's kind of a big deal: The Ron Burgundy Podcast returns for a fourth season. Ron takes the vaccine on the show, and shares details of a pamdemic, affecting women named Pam.
  • Straight up now tell me, is it gonna be me and you together? PEOPLE in the 90's is a new super-rad podcast focusing on a nostalgic look back at the stars and stories that defined a decade, dude. Elizabeth Hurley is in the launch episode; Paula Abdul pops up in episode 3: or is she caught in a hit and run?

item.title: How long should a podcast ad be?
item.description:
In Podnews today: Does size matter? Spotify launches a new algorithmic playlist or two; Podcast Day 24 announces BBC executive as speaker
Visit https://podnews.net/update/how-long-ads for all the podcasting news, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/how-long-ads for all the links, and to get our newsletter.

  • How long should a podcast ad be? SXM Media has released data trying to understand whether longer is better. Spoiler: it is. And it isn't.
  • Spotify has launched a new in-app experience, Only You, an algorithmic tool with artist pairings and data about the podcast and music genres you listen to the most. Blend, also launched today, is a way to blend your musical tastes with a friend for an playlist with the best (and possibly worst) of both.
  • Podcast Day 24, the 24-hour streamed podcasting conference, has announced Jonathan Wall, the Controller of BBC Sounds, joining iHeartMedia's Conal Byrne, NOVA Entertainment's Rachel Corbett and over 100 other speakers for Monday's conference. Tickets are available now; look below for a discount code.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

PRICES INCREASE WEDNESDAY to Podcast Movement 2021 — The world's largest conference and trade show for podcasters and industry pros returns this August in Nashville. Register by midnight Wednesday before prices increase!

Subscribe to Happiness for Cynics — Are you stressed, anxious, or just... meh? Bring some fun and joy into your week while you listen to the latest research on happiness, with a heavy dose of cynicism and a lot of laughs.

Multiple new producer roles at Novel — Numerous opportunities to join the fastest growing British premium podcast company, Novel, including work for the BBC, Audible and US based co-productions, as well as exciting originals launches.

  • Signal Hill Insights suggests that on-demand content is leading to changes in media; but cautions not to write off broadcast TV and radio quite yet.
  • Podcasting's openness is under attack, says Benjamin Bellamy, saying that now is the time to choose between an open or closed industry.
  • Timber launches a professional podcast feedback service, The Edit, today. It promises meaningful, candid feedback on your podcast.
  • Buzzsprout now supports any Podcasting 2.0 channel tag. Libsyn supports channel or item tags.
  • Sesame Street is getting into podcasting with Headspace. The 'sleepcasts', to help kids relax for bed, will have twelve, ha ha ha, episodes.
  • The Irish Times has signed with Acast.
  • MIDiA, a research company, claims that music and podcasts are competing for ear space.
  • Manchester United, a soccer team supported by 659m people, has added the official Manchester United Podcast to their app. Downloads increased by 60% during lockdown; it's also available in video form.
  • Podcast Movement 21 has announced their keynote speakers for their event in Nashville TN, USA; expect Kate Erickson from Entrepreneurs on Fire, and Tom Webster from Edison Research.
  • Popular Android podcast app Podcast Guru is the first to add an integration with Podchaser. You can sign-in to rate podcasts directly from the app: to come will be listen history and reviews.
  • Congratulations to Podcast Gym, a community of podcasters focused on collaboration, growth and success, which is one year old today.
  • The editor of a medical journal, Dr Howard Bauchner, is to step down after racist comments on the journal's podcast. We first reported on this in March; Bauchner neither made the comments, nor approved the podcast or an accompanying tweet; but as Editor in Chief he says he is "ultimately responsible for them".
  • Of note: we've seen two big launches recently that have glossed over the fact they're not in Apple Podcasts (or have given us links that are just RSS feeds). We've asked: these large publishers had problems with Apple Podcasts Connect. Yikes.

Tips and tricks

  • How to get more podcast reviews to grow your audience - Castos first recommends... asking.
  • How to increase confidence on the mic - We Edit Podcasts tells us to stay calm, and to know your stuff.
  • Dan Misener talks about the advantages of the unlisted podcast.

Podcast News

  • From the HubSpot Podcast Network: MarTech Podcast tells the stories of world-class marketers who use technology to generate growth and achieve business and career success.
  • Life Out Loud, a new LGBTQ+ focused podcast from ABC News, posts an interview today with Rufus Wainwright ahead of his tribute to icon Judy Garland on what would have been her 99th birthday.
  • Looking Forward, a podcast that focuses on trends and how they affect you, has our Editor, James Cridland, talking about podcasting trends for the future in the episode due to be released today.
  • Optimal Living Daily has made it to episode 2,000. Justin celebrated by recording the episode upside down for some reason. He must have read it somewhere.
  • Not Past It was launched yesterday by Gimlet and Spotify: a new weekly history podcast, diving into a moment from this very week in history and how it shaped our lives today. It's hosted by Simone Polanen.
  • Undesign is a new weekly podcast that launched yesterday, exploring complex issues from counter-terrorism to sustainable tourism, and revealing insights on how people can redesign a more inclusive society. It's from DrawHistory, a strategy and design consultancy.
  • Ninetwentynine, a nine minute and twenty-nine second podcast for Fiverr, has hit one million downloads. Produced by Listen, it was launched in April 2020.
  • Survival of the Fitted is a new podcast from LeagueFits, an Instagram account for NBA/WNBA fashion and culture. The show highlights the collision/intersection of basketball, fashion and culture.
  • Bubble Trouble, hosted by former Chief Economist of Spotify Will Page and independent analyst and Arete Research founder Richard Kramer, is launching shortly. The podcast plans to "lay out the hidden agendas and uncover some inconvenient truths about how markets really work". It's produced by Eric Nuzum's Magnificent Noise, and will be available in an ad-free format on Apple Podcasts Paid Subscriptions.
  • The UK theatre podcast eleven has joined the Broadway Podcast Network. Their next guest is L Morgan Lee.
